definition: insulting or contemptuous action or speech : derision
examples: laying himself open to the jeers and mockeries of his rebellious subjects

definition: a subject of laughter, derision, or sport
examples: making him turn himself into a merry mockery of all he had once held dear
if it was not a man it was a huge and grotesque mockery of man

definition: an insincere, contemptible, or impertinent (see impertinent sense 1a) imitation
something ridiculously or impudently (see impudent sense 1) unsuitable
examples: in her bitterness she felt that all rejoicing was mockery
